TopicTitle: 77 Industries: Armoured Warfare Division - Light Tank Added!

Articles.Content:
77 Industries Presents

The 77I-1404T3Z1 1.0 heavy chassis is a dream come true for crews who want maximum mobility and armour. This is one of the best chassis ever designed, capable of withstanding 20+ 120mm hits before being totally disabled. Very versatile, excellent range!

Heavy MLRS 1.0

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Crew: 4

Mass: 49.1t

Weaponry: 12x MK1 spin stabilized unguided rockets

Armour: All around, two layers

Suspension: Independent, able to climb over and drive through very rough terrain (limit speed). Capable of driving with 12 of the 14 wheels broken!

Download Link: http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3946

Heavy IFV 1.0

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Crew: 8

Mass: 40.1t

Weaponry: 8x MK1 spin stabilized unguided rockets

Armour: All around, two layers

Suspension: Independent, able to climb over and drive through very rough terrain (limit speed). Capable of driving with 12 of the 14 wheels broken!

Download Link: http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3855

All equipped with my SuperSuspensionTM

Demonstration:

The 77I-1404T2Z1 medium chassis is excellent for those who prefer agility for those fast hit @ run tactics at the edge of scanning range while still having a far above normal survivability compared with the competition.

Medium MLRS 1.0

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Crew: 3

Mass: 34t

Weaponry: 8x MK1 spin stabilized unguided rockets

Armour: All around, one layer

Suspension: Independent, able to climb over and drive through very rough terrain (limit speed). Capable of driving with 12 of the 14 wheels broken!

Download Link: http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3948

Light Tank 1.0

Check that turret!

Weaponry: 3x MKII spin stabilized unguided rockets

Armour: All around, one layer

Suspension: semi-linked, able to climb over and drive through very rough terrain (limit speed).

Download Link: http://kerbalx.com/crafts/3965

Suggested mods:

Take Command (puts kerbals in seats)

Rover Wheel Sounds

Stay tuned for more hardware!

Yes! I'll start this into a series. I've got a few almost ready.

By the way, updating OP now, I've added two new vehicles!

That is one cool looking light tank! Does the turret on the tank have any power source? I got it crewed up but it runs out of electrical charge and then can't turn.

Edited July 26, 2015 by Jon144
Any requests? I can build (almost) any configuration.
Really like the tanks, what is the suspension thing and how does it work?

It's based on the principle that connections between parts have some flexibility, and a spring force. The more parts joined between the wheel and the chassis, the more flexibility and thus more comfortable/less strain on the parts.
